{{cpp/string/basic_string/title|operator[]}}
{{cpp/string/basic_string/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcla|anchor=no|num=1|constexpr=c++20|
CharT&amp; operator[]( size_type pos );
}}
{{dcla|anchor=no|num=2|constexpr=c++20|
const CharT&amp; operator[]( size_type pos ) const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns a reference to the character at specified location {{c|pos}} if {{c|pos &lt; size()}}, or a reference to {{c|CharT()}} if {{c|1=pos == size()}}. No bounds checking is performed.

If {{c|pos &gt; size()}}, the behavior is undefined.

For overload {{v|1}}, if {{c|1=pos == size()}}, the behavior is undefined{{rev inl|since=c++11| if the object referred by the returned reference is modified to any value other than {{c|CharT()}}}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|pos|position of the character to return}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Reference to the requested element if {{c|pos &lt; size()}}, or a reference to {{c|CharT()}} if {{c|1=pos == size()}}.

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;
 
int main()
{
    const std::string e("Exemplar");
    for (unsigned i = e.length() - 1; i != 0; i /= 2)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; e[i];
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
    
    const char* c = &amp;e[0];
    std::cout &lt;&lt; c &lt;&lt; '\n'; // print as a C string
    
    // Change the last character of s into a 'y'
    std::string s("Exemplar ");
    s[s.size() - 1] = 'y'; // equivalent to s.back() = 'y';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; s &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
rmx
Exemplar
Exemplary
}}
